name: RPG Maker MV
description: POWERFUL enough for a developer SIMPLE enough for a child VERSATILE enough for any platform!RPG MAKER MV allows you to make the RPG of your dreams! This latest version includes a host of new featuresand export options for MacOSX, Android, and iPhone!
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft® Windows® 7/8/8.1/10 (32bit/64bit) Processor: Intel Core2 Duo or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9/OpenGL 4.1 capable GPU Storage: 1 GB available space Additional Notes: 1280x768 or better Display
recommended_requirements: Graphics: OpenGL ES 2.0 hardware driver support required for WebGL acceleration. (AMD Catalyst 10.9, nVidia 358.50), iOS 8.0, Android 4.4.4*

reviews.review_text: 1. Get this. 2. Start a project. 3. Make half your database. 4. Decide it's too hard, and give up. 5. Repeat steps 2-4 an indefinite number of times. 6. Decide to actually finish a game. 7. Spend a year making it. 8. Try to play it. 9. Bang your head in frustration when it doesn't work. 10. After three months and an extensive amount of JS knowledge, fix it. 11. Feel satisfied. 12. Repeat steps 8-11 until you're sick of fixing bugs. 13. Release your game. 14. Repeat steps 2-13 for all of eternity, because making games is so fun.  10/10 would get stuck in an infinite loop again.

An easy to use game maker engine that builds off the foundation set by its predecessors. I say 'game maker' rather than RPG maker because it has the potential to create other genres such as action, adventure and visual novel games, just like the previous engines.  Its simple and familiar look makes it easily accessible to people who have already used any of the previous engines, and is approachable to people new to it as well. It contains more features than any of the previous engines. JavaScript looks formidable compared to Ruby, but everything can be learned in time. The character generator has much better parts than the Ace one, and even provides a base and parts for their sideview battles.  Despite the familiar appearance, it has been remade completely, so bugs are expected from something so new. I've only encountered graphical bugs so far, but none of the lag mentioned (using a 4 year old i5 laptop with a generic graphics card that has update-to-date drivers). Just need to point out that practically every single program and game out there has bugs on release. The important thing is that the reported issues are being fixed, the developers just need time.  Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase, and glad to have it despite the bugs. Kudos to the Degica team who worked so hard to see this program released this early, and who are still dealing with the issues related to the program together with Kadokawa.

RPG Maker advertizes itself as being simple enough for a child, but powerful enough for a professional. As someone who has herself programmed games the hard way, I can assure you that this statement is true. For the new game developer, RPG Maker provides a nice framework to understand how mechanics and gameplay can mesh with story and helps learn the basics of game design - how to telegraph things to your players, how to make enemies an appropriate strength, etc. For those who know how to do that, RPG Maker trims the fat, saving you the time of having to program different elemental types while still giving you the option to modify it if you want. And that, I think, is the power of this tool. It presents you with so many options to get you started, but can do so much more if you know how to code.

Although on the surface MV might look 'the same', but underneath the hood it's a completely different beast. MV outshines everything Ace has and out does it on several levels. Thanks to Javascript and a open UI, programming is MUCH more flexible and will allow more possibilities with the engine then what Ruby could provide. Plus just basic changes with the default engine itself: Better Default Resolution (By default 1K, but with Yanfly's Core Plugins it can be set to 2K and higher), An more organized database to easily go through the tabs and change what you need, and the best part for last, An In-Game editor. As someone who pays close attention to detail when ever I had to playtest a game and saw something that needed changing, you had to close the game, bring back up the editor, change it, and go back to the area to see the fix. This was specially annoying when it was during a long cutscene. And when it was multiple problems it's hard to remember what needs fixing or tweaking when going back to the editor, so you could be stuck going back and forth for hours trying to fix the problem. But thanks to the In-Game editor I can easily fix something while the game still runs without having to go back and forth. This cuts down on development time signifcantly. I highly recommand this for anyone new to the RM scene, returning veterns, or upgraders of older RM engines looking for more possibilities.

RPG Maker MV is an a great addition to the RPG Maker Series. I first started using RPG Maker VX Ace approximately two years ago and it was then that I fell in love with the software.  As with RPG Maker VX Ace, MV offers the tools to make an old JRPG styled game with ease. Unlike Ace however, MV is built on JavaScript whilst Ace used Ruby. JavaScript is much more powerful and enables more flexibility in my opinion when it comes to creating/applying plugins. <--- Keep in mind that the scripting part is optional, you do not need any coding to be create an amazing RPG Game. Granted it does help add features to make your games unique.  Pros: - Great Community: I absolutely love the RM Community, you can find tons of resources, tutorials and scripts to use in your projects. The community is quite active, so if you have any questions feel free to ask them. - High Res - (48x48): Compared to VXAce, MV now has a resolution scale allowing for a higher level of quality for sprites and mapping. Always a nice addition. - Tons of customisation options: The character generator has taken a big jump in flexibility since VXAce, allowing for more customisation of faces and sprites. Oh and you can import your own generator parts! The sprite sheets produced also contain more sprites for various situations, side battlers, damage etc. - Easy to learn: As with all RMs, it's pretty easy to get around once you learn the basic functions. - New Prebuilt Side Battler Mode: You can now take the side battler approach for your games as opposed to front facing approach (for battle sequences). This could only be achieved by using a custom script before. - Export to Mac/Android/iOS/PC : A nice feature that enables you to export your commercial/non-commercial projects.  Cons: I'm slightly biased as I absolutely love this software, but I have come across some minor issues that do create additional work when I'm creating my game. - Bugs and Glitches: The software is still relatively new (relative to the original date of this review), so there are some minor bugs still present. In my case, I found some issues with the shadow tool. Certain shaded areas would render when the games were executed. These were usually fixed though by erasing and re-tiling the affected areas.  So do I recommend this software? Absolutely!!! Although, if you're new to the series, I suggest you start of with an older varient such as VX Ace which can usually be found for cheap during sales and on bundle sites such as Humble Bundle and Bundle Stars.  I give this software, 10/10.

Best of its kind. Simpler 'scripting' if we can still call it that, better resolution (you in fact have no resolution limitaitons), character generator is actually really decent and you have a build-in side view battle system. TY RITO GODS.
One thing that our guts tell us to do but so hard to achieve:   FINISH YOUR GAME!!!!    11/10 would TRY to finish it.

RPG Maker MV is a great and flexible engine to bring your game ideas to life.   Being interested in game development, but failing to start because of massive setbacks such as designing characters, creating a setting, and having no direction. However, with the pre-made assets you are able to prototype, prototype, and prototype. I stress this because understanding what you're doing will make you better and faster at making a game. You don't particularly need a story, a whole bunch of characters, or designed assets - the whole point is to understand game dev, and is most definitely worth the price. If you can, get it on sale!  I'm actually interested in the battle mechanics and events. I assure you that you can make a great game if the battle system is fun! Note that I only have about 100+ hours right now, but I still want to keep making and perfecting my game even if all I am working on is battle mechanics and events. It will never be released, but nothing won't stop you if you keep learning about the mechnics of the engine. Javascript makes it extremely flexible.   And as others have said, plug-ins make the process of creation so easy, and there are many free resources online! If you're a beginner and need to experience making an RPG by all means go for this. The continued support for Javascript plug-ins doesn't hurt either.

Back to the days I wrote my first game in RPG Maker 2000, the system was the best game maker. Without any programming knowledge, developers were able to build a great rpg games.   I remembered I abandoned development on RM after RPG Maker XP start working with RGSS. It was flexible, but somehow I felt the scripting language was not modern and will be removed someday.  Now RPG Maker MV fully replaced RGSS with Javascript and it also support plugins, which greatly extend engine features. After 10+ years of time, I purchased MV just for supporting the developers. Thanks Enterbrain. I don't think I will create a game via RPG Maker MV. but I am willing to check out any new games made with MV.

I'm still very new to this and I didn't use VX Ace much. But, I think this is a pretty awesome tool. The character editor is much improved from VX Ace, and you can draw regions using rectangular tools which saves a lot of time. The scripting is now in Javascript, which I am accustomed to. You can press F8 during a playtest to open a full featured Chrome debugger and dig into variables and code with ease.  So far, I'm having a lot of fun with this!

I've spent extensive hours in this program and I absolutely love it. Out of the box it is very simple to create fan games with little experience. If you want to make a polished game it will take a bit more work, but the program offers you tools to accomplish that. With the inclusion of Javascript over Ruby, it is far easier to both create your own plugins, or use other people's created plugins.  The program has the potential to put out quality games in the JRPG and action adventure genre, and with Javascript you could potentially spread this to other Genres as well.   overall, this is a worthwhile purchase if you have an interest in making games but are intimidated by bigger engines like Cryengine or Unreal engine, or you just want to make a fan JRPG / professional JRPG.
Sit down and make a game. Sky is the limit. 10/10

This has to be the best 2d engine I've ever used for creating rpg games, its easy to use and also really powerful for making more complex games. The visual interface is really easy to use for creating items and maps and placing npc's all around the map, but it also comes with a really great event system that lets you create more complicated things like cutscenes and dungeon puzzles without having to do any coding.  Its been a while since rpg maker was this good (last one I liked was rpg maker xp) but rpg maker mv finally brings back the side view option for battles and it now supports more platforms like mac, browser and mobile for releasing your game on the app stores.  Plugin support is already pretty good with lots of custom menu and battle tweaks, although theres no action battle system plugins yet like there was for past rpg makers so you can't make a zelda like game just yet, but the rpg maker community is already putting out tons of content and tutorials to make working with this engine really easy.  This is the first time since rpg maker xp I can highly recommend this engine, rpg maker mv is better then ever before.

Thanks to Enterbrain!!!!  Degica and Kadokawa to bring us this experience. I am not talking only for RPGMMV. When i start with RPGM2K3, from nothing i feel as a master of making games. MV was something i was waiting a long time. Thanks to Archeia too. Because i feel that never will come and she make me believe and wait before move to another Engine. And as always is a experience of knowledge and hard work. I wish to have more time. You always want to do more and more. Thanks to the team that make this possible. And now multilenguaje. :)
I've been finding this new version very easy to use. There's a few things I needed to figure out, but there are a number of tutorials and with those I've been having a lot of fun.

What can be said about a title that allows you to be the one to tell your own story through the media of RPG gameplay? I have used previous RPG Maker titles, but MV is my favorite thus far for a few reasons. There are a number of add-ons you can find and some titles with the right amount of work can come out very well. With this title, literally anyone is capable of making a decent game after mastering a few simple concepts. If they can find the commitment to finish...  I would reccomend this title to anyone who wishes to play around with making simple games and advancing their story telling skills but my reccomendation comes with a warning.  This is the first RPG Maker version that is Mac 'compatable.' I use quotes because on different Mac machines including a 2015 Macbook Pro Retina, the title suffers from an irritating crash issue. When editing events and typing dialogues, I cannot tell you how many times the title simply exits. No error message, no option to save work, no way to recover what you have done. To work around this as a Mac user, save frequently, and do not type longer dialogues without stopping multiple times to save. Other than that, this title works almost flawlessly doing what it was designed for.
Recommended software for your daily game making needs, very versatile and strong software.

If you are looking to jump into making anime style RPGs without too much hassle then this is a great program for you to use. If you have some past coding experience with java then you can do wonders with this program in regards to making highly customized games that are unique to you. RPG MAKER MV comes with lots of tile sets, character styles, and music that allow you to start making games right away.   I am using this program to make personalized games for the grandkids Christmas 2016.  If you are looking to make platformer or top down shooters, or other types of games, then check out Construct 2.
great program helped me create and old type rpg also very fun to kill time with

I'm really impressed by your work. RPG Maker MV is great and stuff. However, there is an issue in your new added function, that removes any unused files from project. I tried to use it and ALL the music from my game got removed. My custom game cursor got removed as well. All unused enemy images got deleted, sure, but that is the only thing done right. So please, fix this issue and make your program scan user's project throughly. Let it take more time, but at least we'll get what we need. Sincerely, Andrew.
This game is awesome. There is nothing else to say. If you like making games, you will love it. Enjoy.
Easy to spend hours playing. Not worth the 70.00 though, I'd wait till it goes on sale.

Oh boy, where do I even start on this? Honestly, I really want to like this. I really do. There are some good things to it - an options menu, the plugins, etc... But there's so much missing that it does not feel right. At all. I didn't need the 'sound test' this includes - VX Ace had something similar to that. However, I do need an assets menu to make importing custom features easier. I do need an easy way to access scripts. I do need some way to import a VX Ace project to MV so I don't have to restart everything. I do need the ability to disable the RTP to make the download size smaller. At least include the characters from the cover art in the actual software instead of DLC, you know?! It's very new, but there are far too many problems for me to just accept it. Simply put, it feels nowhere near complete, ditches some of the most useful parts of VX Ace, and doesn't really bother making up for the things it scrapped.

'Mom look! I made a game!'  In all seriousness, RPG Maker MV is a pretty solid game-making tool. RPG Maker games have been given a bad reputation for being ♥♥♥♥♥♥ fangames, and most of them are... But then someone comes out of no where with something real neato.   But I suppose I should talk about the actual program, right?  As the name implies, you make RPG's. You can only make RPG's, because it's RPG Maker. It comes with a whole bunch of default music, tilesets, enemy sprites, and even a character generator. All are free for commercial use. You can obviously import custom graphics and music if you're an artist or musician. I'm not, so I just upload ♥♥♥♥♥ that I made in MS Paint.  10/10 would make RPG's again.  If you don't want to fall under the stereotype of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ fangame RPG, then I would recommend importing custom stuff. I would also recommend the use of Plugins. Yes, Plugins. If you know javascript, you can write and import any kind of plugin to spice up your game a bit. Or if you have no idea how to do a javascript, you can just take some plugins off of the forums, provided that they're free to use. I highly recommend using plugins by Yanfly, because they make some real neato plugins that are real neato, and free for commercial use. These can be anything from easier menu management, or completely changing the battle system.   RPG Maker requires no actual programming. Did I mention that? RPG Maker uses something similar to Scratch. It's hard to describe, so I won't. Look at the screenshots or some ♥♥♥♥ idk.  RPG Maker MV can export to Windows, Mac, iPhone or Android. The hard part about exporting to iPhone is getting that sonofa♥♥♥♥♥ onto the appstore, because ♥♥♥♥ Apple. You can charge a price, or put it out for free. Just make sure the stuff you use is free for commercial use if you decide to sell your ♥♥♥♥ game.  RPG Maker MV is some good ♥♥♥♥. Ever since I got RPG Maker, I've gotten so many ladies that I'm practically drowning. Now you can trick people into thinking you're a game designer but in reality you make ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Sonic fan-RPG's.   10/10 would make meme games again.

I was RPG Maker XP user, and when I came to this engine It was very easy to adapt.  You can create your own RPG game easily, and if you know to program in JavaScript you can create amazing stuffs in your game.
Best Game Development Tool I have ever used! 10/10
it deploys to PC, MAC, Android / iOS !! more database availability (2k items vs 1k in VX-ACE) !! and FAR more! ---------------------------------------------LOVE IT!
Love it!!!! So easy to use!
i wish they would have a little bit more in the Character Generator but other than that it is working fine and i am haveing no problems.

Really easy to use and great improvements made. Friendly community and lots of tutorial videos to be found. If you are strapped a bit for cash, wait until it goes on sale as it is great for anyone who is into making their own games.

Strengths: High resolution graphics are top-notch. Music is filled with emotions. Character generator is amazing. Features are wonderful. In fact, I think the biggest strength of RPG Maker MV is that they made it very convenient for game creators:  1. Plugins system where you can turn on and off instead cutting the whole script into another project. 2. Holding enter key speeds up your whole game, which can be easily disabled by a plugin. 3. Game can be edited while you are in-game, and changes made to maps are live (just open and close menu to update). Event changes will require you to re-enter the map to update. Database and plugin changes require you to close and reload the game. 4. Switches and variables can be controlled in-game. Just press F9. Very helpful for testing events in-game. 5. A lot of support and updates from community.  Criticisms: Default graphics may be too 'squarish' for those who want to map circular stuff. You can find resources for this though. Auto-shadowing of tiles can be a disaster. Shadowing tool is hard to use. You can't click and drag a rectangle of shadow; you must draw it carefully like a pencil.  Conclusion: Worth buying. It makes your life a lot easier, and produces high quality games.
This game is very addicting and fun im going to buy it on monday

MV is love, MV is life. The side-view character generator is top notch, and the larger resolution for all sprites is amazing. There's already a bunch of scripts available so there's no reason to not switch from Ace.
It was good.
10/10 would spend 30 min making everything water again.

Well my review USED TO BE negative.   But, as promised, I'm going to change my review since they have fixed the problems in the engine/explained how to do some stuff that everyone thought was taken out:  So, here's a pros and cons list:  PROS:  -Huge Database <3  -Javascript Plugins (Not some new language)  -Increased Screensize  -Pre-packaged with Resources and Plugins  -Amazing Music   -Amazning Graphics  -Very fast  -Easy for new users to pick up  CONS:  -Lack of tutorials (due to it being very new)  -You must download the full Database apart from the engine  -Android, IOS, and HTML5 export are confusing
Great Portrait creation except theres not enough faces. I would very much appreciate and would pay for more faces that would allow me to create child characters or chubby/skinny ones.
An easy fun way to make a story/game
Introduction

At the end of the day RPG Maker MV is a great learning tool, especially for understanding basic rpg mechanics. However if you are serious about game development, learning Unreal 4 is better worth your time, and a far more marketable skillset.
This seems like a good idea. But... Its VERY HARD to figure out, once you get the hang of it you will probably make the most facinateing game ever!
Nice software. Get it if you want to be an aspiring game developer. Or, simply just have fun making games
It's sooooooo grat i love it it can be i bit weird when you export to android and ios but over all it is a vary goo softwere so yeah i LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!
Loving everything about this, just trying to get use to it. Watching tons of tutorials and doing story and character creation. The system is nice so far.
Definetly worth the £30! :) I'm making my own game and i just need to make a menu
The Generator is amazing~! I'm Creating Charactors one time but get lots of it!
Good Software Irealy love it. It Awesome

Even if it was free for a weekend I think it was Amazing, but Do you think you could add a tutorial? I know to do somethings from school but where else can I get the information other than searching the internet for hours on end.
Can't go fullscreen or change resolution out of the box. No intellisense. It's crashing. It's like nothing changed since ever.

I recommend this if rpgs is what you want to make. I have made several already and truly do enjoy this because it is easy. I did love how easy this is to use. Even though Unity is said to be easy, it is not as easy as this. 10/10 would rpg again
It is a pretty good software. But it cannot type chinese I hope the developer will make change in this trouble. Thanks.

I really liked VX Ace which was the one before MV and I will say that it is really similar. But it is very different. One of the main things that I like about it is that they kept the VX Ace layout so it is still really easy to use. I really like that they changed the Ruby scripts to JavaScript plugins which well helps me a lot since I actually know JavaScript. Oh by the way you do not need coding knowledge, it is mostly for advance stuff. The whole exporting to different OS is very very neat and you can even run your games in a browser! So, I highly recommend getting this if you want to start out to be a game dev or just for fun.

Love it. May have taken me 5 hours to get down the basics of the map and character stats alone, but i love it. Manipulate your stats do do whatever you want, i havent tried the programing cause idk how, No idea how to make The dang ships work, mostly have been fiddling with the settings, ive enjoyed it so far. any tips in comment of this would be greatly apperciated.

It certainly is a step up. I just hate how they repeat the same annoying decision of adding restrictions with every new rpg maker. They market the engine for platforms such as computer, phone, ect. But it feels like it's more for phones than anything else, as by default, click to move is enabled (You can move normally with keyboard and stuff, but if you want to remove the click to move, There is no option hard coded into the engine. You will most likely have to learn JS just to disable it.) and the maps have a restriction because of mobile devices. (Pretty much, they expect you to code out the click to move and not to mention, make your own .apk files, but think you're too dumb to code for conversion to phones for maps.) But, the engine is still useful none the less. Ace with a little bit extra. Oh, and if you're looking to get this because you think it has improved on the mapping, think twice. The mapping is the exact same as Ace, with (-Rolls eyes.-) the allowance of letting the upper corners overlap. Yep, they lishened to us, and really delievered on that,
The supporting of the tool was slow and the whole thing is not actually ready...

It's a buggy mess at the moment. I can play a game that a friend made but I cant play test my own because I get a white screen. Look this up, tried everything and no one will help. Not even the devs. Glad to know the refund button on Steam works. VX ACE is so much more fluid, it's polished after years of being out and I think the interface is overall better.  MV: 2/10 - It is a cool thought but horrible execution.

Mostly the same as Ace, only a few additions, stuff still missed out like Quest scripts/log functions etc. EXP still not fully customizable, same with stats and LVL. Lack of graphic content, for such a high price you would think you would get alot to work with.  Baught DLC before release, still havent gotten it.   Last RPG Maker I'll ever buy. /z

I would say it's a minor improvement over VX ace. but it crashes constantly, on average every 10 min or so. twice it has crashed as I was saving, wiping the game. in total of over 70 hours down the drain. not to mention some shady stuff is going on, theme 1, theme 2, theme 6? either they're counting is as bad as my grammar, or they have some shady as fudge dlc planned. do not buy this in it's current state. it is a waste of your hard earned mulah,
good game maker rpg but some promlem too few enemies and not easy to use

Bought it on sale, played for a solid hour and refunded it, its buggy, it felt unpolished, and it was so 'Simple' looking it looked like it was made for children... The best things this engine has going for it is that the charecter creator looks better and the multi platform support, other than that it isnt very good.
Came for cute witch girl with hat assets, did not get cute girl with witch hat assests 5/10  Needs more witch hat.
Bugs are being fixed at a very fast speed, thank you RMMV.

Pros: - Really easy to use and at the same time offers many options, so it could be used professionally. - Beautiful interface, and almost bug free. - Exports to many platforms. - Includes a lot of already made content.  Cons: - They disabled the normal scripting that you would see in Rpg Maker Vx Ace, the option to edit all the scripts in the game directly, now you can only include script snippets inside events. But there's still scripting, and in JavaScript.  Overall i think this is an excellent software, and it's definitely worth what it costs. It includes many great features that most game developing software don't include, it has lots of pros and only one con which isn't really relevant.
The best way to learn game development without programming skills!

If you can afford it, and you have the patience to make your own rpg this software is well worth it! I am enjoying it so far while playing with textures and events.  I am however having a problem with the tint screen event, I just can't seem to get that to work no matter what I tried :/ But other than that I love that this rpg maker is higher resolution, I love that you can pick between front or side battle. So overall I am enjoying it so far :) And who knows? Maybe you guys might have better luck than me.
In love with it, I just got it today and already got hook to the new tool that you have at your own use.
Uuuuuuuhhhh definitely a great development tool for those with no scripting knowledge and also for those who do know some Java Script.
Easy to use and you can do a lot without any programming knowledge. Also, quite flexible to do a lot more if you know a little scripting. Great program!

Greatest itteration of RPG Maker yet! Side-view battles added back....like...in-code, added back. No more crazy scripting just to get this to work. That's literally all I ever wanted. And with the resource manager back with the newest update, it's shaping up to be better than RPG Maker '95. =D And the new tool that automatically deletes all the extra files that you didn't use? Love streamlining. Worth every penny.
This is a well made program, easy to use, easy to understand, and fun to mess around with.
It's fine.

After using several other game creators that are on the market, I have been completely blown away by RPG Maker MV. Its ease of use and wonderful community certainly make this the game creation engine of choice for me, and my projects, whthout a doubt. I have enjoyed playing around with the mechanics, and making some really compelling experiences using some of the plugins that are available from our more prominent community members. I certainly recommend this to anyone looking to publish a cool old school style RPG. If you aren't sure that RMMV is for you, visit the official website and get the free trial download! You can test, and make sure that this product will suit your needs. Thanks for the amazing game creator!

I have enjoyed RPG Maker since VX and I love this latest version. The support from the community has been immense this time. The new scripting in Javascript has been an amazing leap and with the plugin manager, even people who struggled with scripts in VX/ Ace should have little problems configuring most scripts. Many of the great scripts have already been converted over and the amount of graphics that have been created by the community is substantial (and many of the best graphics are commercial free). Plus there has been so much music created already with even more coming. Although its not always easy I've heard (I haven't tried yet), you can import to Android and iOS. For previous users the addition of the third layer in the map editor is a much needed improvement.
This is amazing.

After logging almost 40+ hours in less then three days between vx lite and MV full (paid) I only have a few concerns.   I will start off stating I love the software, and reccomend it. But I feel like making the move from vx lite to mv paid left me feeling a little lacking. I had more included options with a lite version of an older app then I did in the one I just spent 80 bucks on. But ok, I know I can add all the stuff easy enough... but no I cant. What I do manage to add doesnt work right. So I please ask for an in app resource manager to be developed and patched in PLEASE! Or just a convenient Import function for icons and such.
Good after patching
This version is great! JavaScript scripting, exporting to mobile devices, bigger screen resolutions, and a much better plugin system. It's definitely worth a try.
IT'S THE COOLEST RPG MAKER EVER!!!!!!!! GET IT NOW!!!!!!!!!!! (Of course, I only had it when it was free, so...) Sadly, it's a ridiculis price.
I like this sofware but one problem... you cant input music unless if it's a M4A1 file or .ogg file
Very easy to use!

One of my favorite introductory programs for game design; while I can't recommend it to anyone attempting to make the next Dragon Quest or Final Fantasy, this tool is definitely one of the best simple game designers.

Simple to use and easy to learn. Makes it possible for almost anyone to make a great RPG if you are willing to put in the effert. I definitely recommend this for anyone who wants to try making their own RPG!
This is awesome :) I love it! It was totally worth it with the 50% deal; I used it for the entire free weekend, and then bought it at the end. It is freaking AMAZING!
good gaming software reccomended if you want to create a game
I have been into RPG Maker after using Vx Ace for a while. Now i can port my games to mobile devices with this new MV.
Unlimited potential, but I can't quite figure out how to tap into it.   Not very nice to new users. AT ALL. But yeah, if you know what you think you are doing, have fun.
